title: How to Install the Windows 7 OS on a Portable Hard Drive

steps.title: Open up Command Prompt as administrator by clicking the Windows Start button.
steps.content: Open up Command Prompt as administrator by clicking the Windows Start button. Type in 'cmd', then right click cmd, click 'Run as administrator' and enter the password if prompted.

steps.title: Type 'diskpart'.
steps.content: Type 'diskpart'.

steps.title: Type 'list disk'.
steps.content: Type 'list disk'.

steps.title: Type 'select disk #' (replace # with your portable drive number).
steps.content: Type 'select disk #' (replace # with your portable drive number). You can find which one it is by checking the size of its hard drive and matching it up with one on the list.

steps.title: Type 'clean'.
steps.content: Type 'clean'.

steps.title: Type 'create partition primary'.
steps.content: Type 'create partition primary'.

steps.title: Type 'select partition 1'.
steps.content: Type 'select partition 1'.

steps.title: Type 'active'.
steps.content: Type 'active'.

steps.title: Type 'format fs=ntfs quick'.
steps.content: Type 'format fs=ntfs quick'.

steps.title: Type 'assign'.
steps.content: Type 'assign'.

steps.title: Exit out of Command Prompt.
steps.content: Exit out of Command Prompt.

steps.title: Open Windows Easy Install.
steps.content: Open Windows Easy Install. Extract it to your desktop or somewhere where you can find it.

steps.title: Open Windows Easy Install.
steps.content: Open Windows Easy Install. Click on the folder Windows Easy Install, then folder NT6.x_fast_installer, then finally click on the folder Windows 7.

steps.title: Click on installer and run it as administrator.
steps.content: Click on installer and run it as administrator. Enter the admin password if prompted. A green command window should open up. Press enter.

steps.title: Wait for it to say "Please select the path of install.wim".
steps.content: Wait for it to say "Please select the path of install.wim". Open your Windows 7 Installer USB or CD. When it is opened, click on sources.

steps.title: Find install.wim at the bottom.
steps.content: Find install.wim at the bottom. Click on it then open it. There should be a list of Windows 7 versions, select one.

steps.title: Enter the drive letter of the partition where you want to install Windows.
steps.content: Enter the drive letter of the partition where you want to install Windows. Simply select your portable drive number.

steps.title: Enter the drive letter of your active primary partition.
steps.content: Enter the drive letter of your active primary partition. Enter your portable drive where you will be installing Windows' number

steps.title: Enter Y when it asks, "Is YOUR DRIVE NUMBER a USB hard disk?"
steps.content: Enter Y when it asks, "Is YOUR DRIVE NUMBER a USB hard disk?"

steps.title: Wait for it to tell you the information is collected.
steps.content: Wait for it to tell you the information is collected. If you want to use another drive letter, put it in then press enter.

steps.title: Wait for the installation to complete.
steps.content: Wait for the installation to complete. When it's done, boot it up from your portable drive.
